Reviews.Title: “Small room but clean, quiet, comfortable and Ace brekkie”
Reviews.Author: Fussy_People
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Palazzo Paruta for a five night stay in Venice. The room was not a bargain, but neither were any others we were looking at for Easter weekend. When we were shown to our room, we were dismayed at the small size, and especially the very limited storage space for five nights of clothes. However, once we had worked out how to get around this, we had a very comfortable stay here. The bed was large and comfortable, the room was very nicely decorated, well cleaned every day, and the bathroom was good. Breakfast was great with a large range of food, including the option of freshly cooked pancakes or omelettes, and freshly baked home-made cakes every day. The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will defenitely be going back!!”
Reviews.Author: Stef G
Reviews.Content: This was hotel was the highlight of our trip. The room was huge and decorated in a classical venician style. The common areas were also very very nice, they have a lovely enclosed courtyard. Also, the breakfast was magnificent. Most of all i was impressed with their service, all the employees were very helpfull and pleasant. Regarding the location, i really liked the area because its quiet but still 10min (max) from the main canal and the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and romantic”
Reviews.Author: TheQuokka
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were very warm upon arrival, and we were personally escorted to our room where they had given us a complementary bottle of prosecco. The standard room and bathroom are very clean, and the bed was really confortable with lots of pillows and a lovely view to the picturesque courtyard. There was a great variety for breakfast, including cake! They also invite guests to have drinks and cake with them in the afternoon - complementary. Location is good too, 10 minutes walk from San Marco or Rialto, and very easy access to the water bus. It's so quiet too, our room was the only one on our floor and we weren't affected by any noise from other guests. Having looked at other bigger hotels in Venice, I find it hard to think you will find a better value-for-money hotel in the City. It certainly helped make our trip very romantic. Oh, and free Wi-Fi! Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy2012
Reviews.Content: Venice was a surprise birthday trip for my husband and what a lovely surprise it was! The hotel is in a great location, just minutes away from a water bus stop. The room we had was on the smaller side but felt so luxurious, bathroom was a good size and nicely done. Breakfast was just fantastic with lots of choices and complementary afternoon tea in a red room was just great:-) I hope we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “lovely 5 day break for two”
Reviews.Author: blackline
Reviews.Content: After browsing the available 'boutique' hotels we settled on the Paruta and it turned out to be a good choice. Easy to get to using route #2 from the airport and only 5 min walk from S.Angelo stop. It is ideally situated in the San Marco area for all the major attractions, being very easy to navigate to and from. Our only issue was that we booked our trip through a 'latedeals' agency and we got the room (156) which turned out to be the smallest in the hotel and located by the kitchen so guaranteed to get an early wakeup. Although having a nice decor, like all the rooms, there is no view and you will have to live out of your suitcase. We did ask for an upgrade but would have ended up paying extra so we decided to use the money for our daily needs (good job too as Venice is QUITE EXPENSIVE), but we did find a nice bottle of champagne in our room courtesy of the hotel. Breakfast was the continental/frankfurter-egg style etc and the staff very friendly and attentative.The free afternoon tea/coffee/cake was a nice addition. Overall a very attractive hotel and worth a look at.

Reviews.Title: “romantic anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Jackie D
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Lovely decor and courtyard. Breakfast room and food spectacular. Only draw back was we had a attic room with low beams. Being tall we had to keep stooping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic place”
Reviews.Author: Zybalova
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel i have ever stayed. Hotel located 10-15 walking distance from San Marko square in a very quate place. I stayed in Junior Suite with the canal view. It was unforgatable. Large room with antuque style and furneture.We have 5 oclock tea with the cake in nice room with the red furnuture. the breakfast was very variety even with the champagne. If you are looking for lovly and romantic place for a good memories Paruta hotel is the best ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sadie046
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for my husbands birthday. The first night they upgraded our room and for his birthday there was a bottle of champagne in our room. The staff were more than accommodating. The breakfast was one of the best we have had. I would definitely go back. The location was pretty central as well.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, excellent breakfast...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Fancyacuppatea
Reviews.Content: We came here on our anniversary and were looked after on arrival. Small rooms but very well furnished and clean. Location is perfect, close to the grand canal waterbus stops and a short walk over river to Dorsoduro (cool area). One of the best breakfasts I have had in Europe and attentive staff. Slightly annoying music being played in the hallways at times, but minor issue. Standard double just fine, overlooking courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: raokartik99
Reviews.Content: First off, do not believe the hotel websites pictures of its Palazzo Paruta suite as its not that big, this is NOT a luxury hotel by any standard, its certainly a very good hotel. I booked the paruta suite and the junior suite canal view for my first anniversary after looking at the trip advisor reviews, and i was not disappointed, the hotel is very charming, excellent location the staff is very helpful indeed but the so called breakfast is not that amazing its OK, and there is NO room service. Now the rooms, the Paruta suite is narrow but looks expensive , the murano chandelier is gorgeous but bathroom is tiny, NOT impressed. Junior Suite with the Canal view is a much better choice as the room is very well spaced out and it does not look like a narrow lane like the Paruta suite, although the bathroom is smaller in this one but still very happy with the room. the staff is always ready to help and as there not many people working in the hotel they are constantly working hard to make their guests happy. The breakfast was not great at all, people raving about it clearly have not been to good hotels. Overall this is a good choice but its not going to blow you away, the junior suite is gorgeous and the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Libba_Jones
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite and a standard double at this hotel. The junior suite was amazing, huge and palatial with a view over a small canal. The standard double was understandably a lot smaller with a view over a small courtyard and although well decorated and furnished slightly disappointing as there was no kettle and tea and coffee making facilities, or shampoo and conditioner etc in the bathroom. However overall our experience was excellent - the breakfasts were huge and varied and we even had a glass of prosecco! All the staff were really friendly and helpful and whilst we were there they offered complimentary tea,coffee and cake in the lounge between 4 -5pm which was very much appreciated after a long day sightseeing. This hotel is really well situated and we loved it! We thought it excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: franno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break in March. Lovely small hotel in a really good location, easy walking distance from main sights and vaparetto stop. Very friendly staff, great breakfast and comfy room. Lovely touch is afternoon tea served every day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Irinaz
Reviews.Content: Having read Tripadvisor reviews, we were very much looking forward to our stay at Palazzo Paruta but it feels like a let-down. Good things first: the hotel is centrally located â€“ a short walk to St Marcoâ€™s and 2mins to a water-taxi stop. The entrance is discreet (which is nice in the madness of the carnival). The breakfast is excellent with a selection of cold and hot foods and custom-made omelettes. The room was clean and fresh with a spacious bathroom. Here is what we found disappointing: - The room was beautiful but tiny. We struggled for space, especially getting dressed for the carnival. If our suitcases were any bigger (we had two tiny cases) , we wouldâ€™ve really struggled for space. - The hotel provided zero information about the Carnival â€“ no flyers, nothing. And that In the midst of the Carnival! (other hotels we stopped by provided plenty of information) More than that, when we asked the reception to help us book tickets to a ball, the staff said they couldnâ€™t do it. - There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Neither does the hotel have a bar or room service. This wouldnâ€™t normally be an issue but returning at night after a chilly day out, it would be nice to have an area to relax with a drink. The hotel is nice but personal touch is missing and I wouldnâ€™t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: minibautas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Palazzo Paruta during Carnavale on our honeymoon. The location of the hotel is perfect - central to all the sestiere and close to the fantastic restaurants & bars of Dorsoduro. Our room was very cute, set in the right-hand corner of the pretty courtyard. It was small, lavish, quiet, private, and had a wonderful bathroom. It was also immaculately cleaned each day. Breakfast was fantastic - as well as the standard cosmopolitan fare there was also a rotation of baked goods (tiramisu!!!), prosecco, and pancakes to order. My wife has a gluten-intolerance and the breakfast staff were very accommodating. All in all the hotel added inordinately to our Venetian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Venice magic”
Reviews.Author: MarkKingscliff
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous (palatial) and the hotel was an authentic part of the Venice experience - originally built in the 1500's - 5/10 minutes walking distance to the sights of the city, but in Venice they start just outside your door. Easy to find and a quiet refuge from the hectic pace a casual visitor moves to. Included breakfasts were sumptuous and the chef was always there with his freshly cooked cakes and pancakes made to order. What a wonderful start to any day. A wonderful experience providing luxury within reach of the average traveller. A short walk to the vaporetto wharf at San Angelo and buying a 2 or 3 day pass is well worth the money to hop on and off the most convenient and scenic means of transport in the city, including to outer islands of Murano and Burano

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: KRZ-Malta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palazzo Paruta for 3 nights. Location was great, 10 mins walk from Piazza San Marco and from Rialto Bridge. Staff very friendly, polite and always helpful. Bfast was good enough, with very polite and welcoming pancake 'maker' ready to please your taste buds. Slight snag was wifi in room did not work well but ok in rest of hotel. Room comfy, very red!!! Awesomely quiet at night which made our sleep bliss. Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madkitty2003
Reviews.Content: What a stunning hotel - this really should be your first choice when staying in Venice. Everything about the hotel was superb - the location is increible, 2 mins frmo the grand canal and 5 mnis to St Marks Square. The hotel is a beautiful place in an old Venetian style and decorated beautifully. The standard rooms are rather small but the service and the friendliness of the hotel surpassed any negatives, it was just like staying in a friends home and they really couldnt do enough to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo Paruta for 2 nights in the Junior Suite and it was absolutley beautiful. The room was amazing and very spacious. They were also very accomodating as we were travelling with young children. The staff were outstanding and the facilities were second to none. Fantastic location and very good value for money. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel,location staff all faultless”
Reviews.Author: Lynn N
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights in Venice for my Birthday at Palazzo Paruta, what a fantastic experience, the staff were wonderful, the location could not have been better, Venice was spectacular!!! The room albeit small (standard room) was spotless we did look at the suites whilst in the hotel and they were just to die for!!! Huge and the furnishings wonderful well worth paying the extra, however saying that our standard room was excellent value for money. The breakfast exemplary cereals, croissants, crepe's to your taste, scrambled eggs bacon & sausage, all types of cake, yoghurts, bread rolls and bread for toast a selection of cold meats and cheeses, what a selection. We will definately return and would advise anyone to visit Venice and stay at Palazzo Paruta.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JforJason
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night in the junior suite with a canal view on the first floor (room in front of the elevator, which was very convenient), and we were blown away by how large the room was (at least for the junior suite). the ceiling was high, the room was spacious and had a majastic feel to it. Very comfortable beds and pillows too (which I find important to have a good night's sleep). We even had a welcome champagne - which added to the great experience. The bathroom was also great, with a heating rack that was really put to good use (heating up towels and your clothes during the cold months of December). Service was great from the start - I had booked a double room through booking.com and subsequently requested for an upgrade (which they did at a EUR 20 discount); Asked them if they could help reserve restaurants, which they did, and even provided some suggestions. I've always gotten very quick replies from their staff (which I think is a good preview of service level). At the hotels, the receptionist gave us a warm welcome and the bell boy (there only seems to be one bell boy and one other chambermaid by the way, which I guess is find given there're only about 14 rooms) was really helpful as well. Breakfast was fantastic - good spread and also great service (the lady who seemed to be in charge of the breakfast area attended to our every need). There is even complementary tea and coffee served from 4 to 5.30pm (if I remember correctly) in the terrace, which is the room that the stairs from the reception area lead up to. All in all, a great and romantic experience for the both of us and we'd definitely recommend this cozy hotel to all tripadvisor surfers!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: beksie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. It is a great hotel in the centre of Venice and easy walking distance from pretty much everything. Very pleasant staff and beautiful rooms, a fantastic buffet breakfast with different choices each day, and great coffee!! The rooms are beautiful, although a little on the small side (my husband felt a bit claustrophobic from the low ceilings). Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bath, comfy bed, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Emy2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a ground floor room on the courtyard. The room was a tad small but made up for it with the bed and bathroom. The hotel is beautifully presented, friendly staff and delicious buffet breakfast. I would definitely stay here again, especially in warmer months to enjoy the terraces and courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorBiktor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a incredible finding. Central location in the heart of Venice Island, easily accessible by boat (S. Angelo Station). Staff were very polite and also regardfull. My wife has been presented with a cocktail and champagne mounted in our room as her birthday. The room was very luxurious and balmy. Breakfast was delightful, included fresh fruits, cheese selections and tiramisu. A supplementary coffee-break is offered daily from 4 to 5pm. I think this is one of the best places to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: sofieuk
Reviews.Content: A very nice 4 star hotel. We had a Junior Suite and the room was huge. The staff are very welcoming and pleasant and providing afternoon tea was a real bonus. On the first night we found it very difficult to find our way back but we made sure we remembered landmarks when we ventured out again so it was a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with old school luxury look”
Reviews.Author: TH3R
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - close to the boat ferry dock (about 2 mins if you can find it!), and close to Saint Mark's Square. very good location. STAFF - friendly, helpful, and spoke English fairly well. ROOMS - large, luxurious (in an old-school Italian way) rooms. plenty of space to move about, with seating area, and a large luxury bathroom. free WIFI which is quite nice/convenient. bed was quite comfortable as well. the rooms definitely made the stay feel quite special. BREAKFAST - a nice, but small selection of sweet items mostly, and cereal. i can't remember if they had any savoury things to choose from. decent, but nothing to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fimpsy
Reviews.Content: A delightful small luxurious hotel located within walking distance of most places in Venice. This hotel is very personable and staff were most helpful and friendly. The room was located downstairs off a small corridor and was very plush and welcoming. The interior was of a very high standard, the bathroom was very large and suitably equipped. Considering I was there during winter with lots of snow, the room was nice and warm. The breakfast was good and catered for vegetarians quite nicely. The hotel is within a 10-15 minutes stroll to St Markâ€™s square, or longer if youâ€™re ambling and enjoying the shops. I found this hotel to be in a great location for walking to all areas of Venice, in fact I only used the water taxi once, thereby making a huge savings on travel costs over the week I was there. Venice is a great place for just soaking up its charming and romantic atmosphere and wandering the quaint alleyways. Iâ€™ve been three times so far, twice at the tail end of August and this time in mid December. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting in the winter, albeit during a dreadfully abnormal snowy and cold time, as there are fewer tourists and Venice seems to be there just to please you. If visiting in the winter, make sure you wrap up warm as the sea breeze is chilling! I would highly recommend this place and would definitely stay there on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Complete luxury as soon as you arrive”
Reviews.Author: Robyn L
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe our eyes when we were shown to our room. It was better than the photos show. The front office staff were very helpful in telling us the local places to eat. We are only here for one night but will stay here again next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within the historic district of Venice withits own bridge and water taxi entrance, we arrived by water taxi and as the tide was in were brought straight to the door, The staff are extremely accomodating with excellent englis and are happy to provide any and all support you would ever need from restaurant recommendations to tours and day trips. We were there from 22nd to 25th October and had 3 wonderful sunny days, the last day it rained but that didnt dampen our spirits, This hotel was perfect for us, the rooms were not huge but comfortable and extremely well mantained and decorated, the cortyard was airy and relaxing, the breakfast area was well stocked and service was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples who want a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Polyceph
Reviews.Content: WOW- This is the most amazing hotel. Small and intimate. The staff were some of the nicest and most obliging I've come across in a hotel (e.g. You ask for something and they say "We'll be right up", and a minute later there's a knock on the door- wish the staff in every hotel did that.) Its centrally situated, just a short walk from the vaporetti wharf, San Marco's Square, Rialto etc, and has a number of excellent restaurants close by. We stayed in a junior suite with a canal view- a huge room with very comfy bed, and of course a unique Venetian view. The whole place has a magic feel- You can almost imagine the family that built the building centuries ago, still being there. You're made to feel like you're a house guest rather than a hotel client. One highlight was the breakfasts, complete with freshly made espresso (you're in Italy after all!), omelette, cakes baked that morning, fruit, pastries etc etc. Having stayed there I would never go anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: griswalds59
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palazzo Paruta after reviewing the Trip Advisor reviews and are very glad we did. You will most likely arrive by water taxi as it is a bit hidden away and probably would have a little trouble finding it on foot. The receptionist and porter was very helpful on our arrival - the room very "venetian" . The location is very central and you can walk everywhere easily although you may have a little trouble finding the Hotel on your return thanks to the winding alleys of Venice. Breakfast is wonderful with so many choices from fruits, cereals, hot breakfast as well as good coffee and freshly baked cakes ! If youre looking for a good hotel in Venice - the Palazzo Paruta is the one !

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Beautiful, Welcoming Hotel in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: LindsayPaige
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family birthday trip to Venice and it was my job to book the hotels for five of us. I could not be happier with my hotel choices, one of which was the stunningly beautiful Palazzo Paruta. My brother stayed in a standard room, my sister and her boyfriend in the superior room and my boyfriend and I splurged on the Junior Suite with a canal view. All of the rooms were gorgeous, but walking into my room was like walking through a time portal to old Venice. The room was huge and elegant, decorated with marble, gold and red so that you feel like royalty. In the center hung a huge Murano chandelier that I think I could have looked at for hours. The very large windows open wide so you can view the canal and the small bridge leading into the hotel. Venice is a quiet city, so we left them open at night to let the breeze lull us into sleep... Palazzo Paruta was our first hotel, so we arrived tired and disheveled from the airport. We were too early for check-in, but they let us do the paperwork and stored our bags for later. They were cleaning up breakfast and kindly made us all espressos and some delicious chocolate mousse which gave us enough of a sugar kick to press on until check in. That was above and beyond and it made us feel very welcome and at home. We left for lunch and, by the time we came back, our rooms were ready. Breakfast in the morning was delicious, the staff was very friendly and the check-out was a breeze. The location of the hotel is perfect - far enough away from San Marco to retire away from throngs of tourists, but close enough to get everywhere (Rialto, San Marco, Dorsoduro) quickly. If I return to Venice, I will surely stay here again. Thank you Palazzo Paruta for a truly lovely experience. P.S. Before we arrived in Venice, the hotel helped us make a much coveted dinner reservation at La Zucca in Canareggio. It was nice to have their help and it really speaks to the level of service that they provide to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: speedrail
Reviews.Content: Recently spent three nights at the Palazzo Paruta with my girlfriend, and we were absolutely amazed by the hotel. We splurged on the Junior Suite (canal view) and upon entering the marble-filled space felt as if we had walked into a different time. Unbelievable room, helpful staff, and great central location within walking distance to all major attractions. Protip: take advantage of the complimentary water taxi to Murano - you will be escorted into a glass factory and encouraged to purchase a piece (the factories pay for the taxi service), but do not feel obligated to stay. Politely decline and enjoy your trip to Murano!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackandKristina
Reviews.Content: Before arriving we emailed the hotel for directions from the train station which proved to be a worthwhile exercise as it is quite hard to find the first time you arrive but once you know it is easy. Upon arrival we found a lovely and pleasant hotel in the beautiful city of Venice for our 2 night stay. We were upgraded to a deluxe room on arrival which was a pleasant surprise. The room was spacious and opulently decorated with deep reds and gold, fitting in with Veniceâ€™s personality! The location is very good to explore the city. Breakfast has a good selection and the wifi was free. We were able to leave our luggage free of charge until our late evening train. Would thoroughly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: LRWanderlust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over 3 nights in June 2011. Everything about it was tremendous - location, room, breakfast, courtyard. But the highlight of our stay was the wonderfully helpful staff! They were outstanding with directions, restaurant recommendations, and general information about Venice. We stayed in a standard room and were pleased. All furnishings and fixtures were high quality, though I wouldn't necessarily say opulent. In my experience, for the price paid, it was overall a bargain by European hotel standards. One morning after breakfast, we had the opportunity to poke our heads in a suite the housekeeping staff was cleaning. And I will definitely say that, if we have the fortune to return to Venice, we will spend the money to stay in a Palazzo Paruta suite. It would clearly be money well spent. The only minor complaint we had is that the adjacent canal created a faintly unpleasant odor in our room on the warmest day we were there. From my perspective, that's hardly the hotel's fault. We were told that it's fairly rare and I have no reason to disbelieve the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem tucked away in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PeterMarina
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to find a complimentary bottle of Champagne in our room for the final leg of our Honeymoon, in this charming small hotel, full of Venetian grandeur. Very clean room with classical furniture, friendly staff and decent breakfast. Courtyard candle-lit in evenings. Room overlooked canal, albeit rather scruffy outside. Hotel staff very helpful in getting us back to our water taxi (a fair walk with heavy bags).

Reviews.Title: “Traditionally Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fatmuscle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we expected and more. The staff were superb and very helpful in all instances. The breakfast was lovely and well appointed with awesome pancakes available to order. The room was traditionally venetian and it suited us down to the ground if a little small. The bathroom was great with a top class shower. The postion was excellent and less than 10 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge and Pallazo San Marco with some great restaurants and bars near by in Campo San Stefano and Campo San T'Angelo itself. We couldn't complain about a thing, the only slight negative is that the room was a little small but that is very minor when considering how little time one spends inside a hotel room when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Steve_20511
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at this delightful hotel. It sits in the middle of everything, but far enough out of the way of the touristy crowds. The hotel itself sits right on a canal at the end of its own little bridge. It has an open courtyard in the middle. The interior has just been remodeled. It is spotless. Our room was state-of-the-art with a marble bathroom, double spout shower, completely clean. The bedroom was impeccable with fancy linens, beautifully finished walls and a window that opened into a garden. The breakfast was first class, including homemade cakes, fresh fruit, an omelette chef and a barista who made custom espresso drinks, including the best capuccino I have ever had. The staff was wonderful, classy and helpful. All of their employees speak English. The hotel is right by the charming Campo San Stefano which has several cafes. The cafes at San Stefano are much more reasonably priced than those in the busier areas. I recommend Cafe Paolin for great cocktails, coffees and excellent gelato. We will stay in this hotel again. In fact, we can't wait to go back. Happy travels, everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - very VenetiaStyle”
Reviews.Author: ChantalGeneva
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here, right on the canal by the Place Campo Sant Angelo. Excellent service, accommodation and location with wifi and air conditioning and several good restos nearby. Lovely Venitian style decoration. The inner courtyard is very peaceful and the breakfast room is like a museum. In fact, the breakfast room and the awesome breakfast is reason enough to stay here. We loved it and we will return hopefully one day.

Reviews.Title: “a dream”
Reviews.Author: Aurelie73
Reviews.Content: Really nice staff, good advise for restaurants, visits, etc. Hotel is well : near the main monuments but isolated from the tourists. It's very quiet, clean, charming. excellent food (especially the breakfasts and its cakes!). Nice external lounges to chill out. Excellent price/quality ratio. You feel at home in less than five minutes

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, loved staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Sally503975
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 4 nights in Venice, staying at the Palazzo Paruta. Lived up to all our expectations Admittedly, we had booked a Junior suite with canal views so was expecting something special and it did not disappoint. The room was huge with an amazing Murano glass chandelier (not to my taste but nevertheless striking). The bed was huge and canopied and the room was furnished with antiques and paintings of Venice. The bathroom was a little small, considering the size of the bedroom, but nonetheless clean and perfectly acceptable. The breakfasts were great, you could even have tiramisu if you wanted! Choice of fruits, cakes, cereals, breads, croissants, freshly made pancakes and omelettes, fruit smoothies, cheeses, meats, bacon, sausages, tomatoes - I could go on and on!! A real feast if you want it. The staff were very helpful on recommendations, travel questions etc. The location was very good and within a short walking distance of all the main attractions of Venice, but quiet in the evening - so a good night's sleep! I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel if you are looking for something special, but it doesn't come cheaply. The only negative thing about the hotel is that it doesn't have a bar, which would have been nice to come back to and relax in the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “PHOTOS don't look anything like the room we got!”
Reviews.Author: Donna050
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to say, we had a pretty decent time there. BUT... the room we got was impossible to believe it was even in the same hotel they advertise!! We almost touched our heads on the ceiling, it looked like we got the maid's room or the nanny's room. Unbelievable. Fortunately we are good travelers and didn't complain or it might have ruined a magical time in a magical city. The service was wonderful, everyone who whorls there does their best I believe. but there is no way to view this hotel as a four star. My experience makes it a questionable three star. Sorry, but the room was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeauMecEdm
Reviews.Content: Great front desk staff. We had the junior suite which was very spacious and comfortable with lots of closet space and various drawers. Breakfast was excellent. Location is very central and short walking distance to S. Angelo vaporatto stop.

Reviews.Title: “A Venice gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelers349
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just a 5 minute walk from the S. Angelo number 1 vaparetto stop, the hotel's lobby and guest rooms are very attractive. The reception desk staff members are friendly and very helpful. Our rooms were clean, well furnished and comfortable. The A/C was very effective in Veniceâ€™s heat and humidity. The breakfast provided, consisting of a large array of hot and cold items, is easily as fine a breakfast as can be found in Venice. I believe you will be as delighted with your stay as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MBOregon
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Paruta was a magical place to stay in Venice! The stop to get off San Angelo was very central. Make sure to e-mail the hotel ahead of time and they will provide you a walking map which makes it extremely easy to get to the hotel. It is essential as you approach the piazza to look to the far right for the stairs to cross the bridge which lead you right to the front doors. The room was smaller than we thought but impeccable. The breakfast was incredible! It is about a 6-8 minute walk to the main sites. I enjoyed not being in the hustle and bustle where all the tourists were, but close enough to take advantage of being within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: MarijanaTea
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and superb rooms! Breakfast was by far the best we have ever had in Italy! It is overpriced, but that is the case with every hotel in Venice. We booked a superior room (#104) with a canal view. An inner courtyard surrounded with palm trees and flowers with a comfy sitting area gives this hotel a special charm.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venitian Palazzo Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: aussie-glaswegians
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Palazzo Paruta and had a wonderful time. We stayed in the Junior Suite with canal view on the first floor and this was a wonderful room, elegantly decorated with plenty of space. Bath/shower was a little awkward with high step into bath making the ceiling low however the water pressure was good and there was plenty of space within the bathroom for dressing etc. My advice would be to take your own hair dryer as one provided was not very good. Breakfast was lovely as described by everyone else. We also used the courtyard/terrace as a place to sit and have a drink in the evenings (we bought our own wine from near by supermarket as there is no bar but they did provide glasses) or eat a sandwich at lunch time in order to avoid the extremely high costs of the cafes/restuarants nearby. The hotel was a little hard to find but with a map (we printed out the one on their website) it was an easy walk from sant angelo vaporetta stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: puki_chabi
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, although a bit small. The location is quite close to the grand canal. The stuff was very friendly. The breakfast was excellent ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! Both tasty & served in a nice hall. We enjoyed very much staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really a hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: paulcaracas
Reviews.Content: Great neighbourhood, close to palazzo Grassi, Vaporetto stop, Rialto and San Marco. Large rooms with nice views, great breakfast in a wonderful period room, manager Nicola was a wonderful host, very caring

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gd144
Reviews.Content: First I had to ask drections to find the hotel. Although check-in is not until 2pm, most hotels would usually be ready to accommodate you at noon. We arrived at 12.30 and had to wait until 2pm for our room. We were not offered any refreshments while waiting. The hotel staff were aware that this trip was for a retirement/anniversary and told us that there would be complimentary wine, chocolates, biscuits in our room for us on arrival. We spent 4 nights there and never received any of this. The room was very very small, tiny in fact. You could not fully open the wardrobe door because the bedside locker was in the way and the window opened onto the courtyard which gave rise to a lot of noise early every morning while staff were preparing breakfast, shouting etc. Barely enough room for one person in the bathroom and there was no bath as advertised just a shower. Saying that, the bed was just about big enough but the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Breakfast was good for anyone with a sweet tooth as it consisted of lots of cakes, pancakes, tarts and pastries. Staff at breakfast were very pleasant and efficient. There is no bar in the hotel also. All in all, Venice is a beautiful city but I cannot believe this is the same hotel in the other positive reviews. I would not stay there again, or recommend it. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Like a real palace!”
Reviews.Author: larry_downy
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel so much! It was a great trip to Venice and we enjoyed it very much! The hotel is very beautiful. It is situated on the little channel, close to San Marco square. There is a garden insight the hotel - very nice. The room was charming! We felt like we were king and a queen! Breakfast was so good! And we even had champaign - it was included in buffet. The staff was also amazing - so helpful! If I come back to Venice - I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Almost my Venetian dream suite ...”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: After drawing myself away from Venice two years ago, in order to visit the rest of Italy, I was back for the Venice Carnevale 2011 with my husband. After seeing the beautiful Paruta suite advertised in the Palazzo's website, I was drawn to it immediately, thinking would I be lucky enough to own this suite during Carnevale, 2011? Yes, I was, after cancelling another Grande Canal facing new Palazzo which uses modern day furniture for their rooms (yucks, but pardon me). Admittedly, I only stay at easily located Venetian hotels during past visits - either on Riva degli Schiavoni (Londra Palace, Metropole, Savoia e Jolanda for great Lagoon views) or next to Vaporetto stops (Palazzo Stern, Foscari Palace, Ca Sagredo, Luna Baglioni for easy accessibilty ). So this is the very first Venetian hotel that is harder to locate. But I have done enough research and found this Palazzo within 5-6 minutes of walking from the Sant Angelo vaporetto stop. So, it is not that difficult to find if you do enough home work. Check in was cordial and prompt by Ms Alessandra. My first impression on seeing the Paruta Suite (room 157) was - Wow, it was worth it just for the Murano chandelier alone! Second impression was - the suite sure looks much smaller and older than in the advertised pictures. But still, I really enjoyed our two nights stay in this huge, 50sqm suite, and we slept like babies (very comfy beds and pillows - hard to find in Italy!). I kept looking up at the gorgeous stuccoed ceiling and colourful stuccoed walls - really amazed and impressed by the Venetian artists of bygone years! The suite has 3 very tall windows, facing two internal courtyards, looking either at the Hotel's other rooms or at someone elses ' apartments. The long and narrow balcony that comes with the suite was not to be used as it was rather dirty and there are no chairs nor tables to sit on it. Bathroom wise, it was certainly less than 50 sq feet in overall size. With two persons in it at the same time, you can't help but to feel quite cramp. There was no shower nor jacuzzi here. You would have to shower in the tub but there is a screen to block off water. The tub was rather narrow, in my honest opinion and I am only medium built. But almost everything in the bathroom was covered in white marble though. A small minibar was in the suite that offers biscuits, chips, chocolates, wine, beer and drinking water, all at very reasonable prices (say 3-5 euros each). This is surely a good gesture indeed as I could not locate any supermarket in close promixity. And needless to say, the Hotel's common areas are indeed beautiful, quite palatial, charming and very well kept. Lastly, the often mentioned breakfast was indeed really very good! It was much better than some 5 star Italian hotels that we had stayed at. Surprisingly, we could find items that are not seen at other hotels' breakfasts here - beans with ham, cheese baked with prawns and mushrooms, grilled vegetables - YUM! OK, now for the not so goods - only plastic cups are to be found in the suite, no glass cups, so if you are travelling with a small travel kettle like us, good luck! The TV was only 26 inches flat screen, deemed to small for such a large suite. And don't know if we were unlucky, we could not locate a single English TV channel while there? And the free Wi fi was also very spotty, only managed a 2-3 hours during a 3 days stay. Toiletries given was the kind of bath foam combined with shampoo type, so go figure ... But the worst complaint has to be having to walk on 'ICE', yes, imagine terrazzo floors at 0-8 degree C during early March and when we asked for slippers, their answers was a NO - we don't provide them. Not really 4 stars after staying all the 3-5 star hotels in Venice and all over Italy! Overall, we have had a great stay at this bella Palazzo. At their highest Carnevale peak, this suite was going for 300 euros a night. So if you could get it for say 200-250 euros, I would say it is still pretty good value. Go for it, you shouldn't be disappointed (though my husband was as he is a technology guy - no English TV channels and no internet connection is a big turn off for him!). To the owners of this new Palazzo - Bravo for a job well done but don't be penny wise and pound foolish. Don't save on that few euros as I seriously felt that your Palazzo has great potential, really! Keep up the good work and we shall be back ...

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: coconut-peter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, only 10 minutes walk from San Marco, also not too far from the Rialto Bridge and Dorsoduro. The room was small but quite luxurious, and the breakfast was absolutely fantastic - they will even cook up a chocolate crepe or banana flambe if you wish! All the staff here were friendly and happy to help in any way - thoroughly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated, ALL staff were fantastic and gave a wonderful service, it really was a delight to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaJM
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderfully helpful and kind. The breakfast was beautifully presented with more than you could wish for. The service was brilliant! The location is central so ideal and the whole experience brought one of relaxation and the romantic feeling of Venice. My husband and I said we would certainly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Room”
Reviews.Author: SpiderBoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel claimed I would feel like a Venetian noble and I did. Our suite was amazing. Incredibly high ceilings, opulent fittings, a large amazing colored glass chandelier, a bed from out of this world and views of the canal. The bathroom was smaller but a renovated marble masterpiece. Breakfast was also extravagant where they will whip up an omelet or banana flambÃ©. You could almost squeeze another star onto the 4 it gives itself or at least half of one. Palazzo Paruta is well located near San Marco which is about a 10 minute walk across bridges and pass lots of retail therapy. The Rialto Bridge is also about 10 minutes walk away. The price on booking.com was very good which probably helped our appreciation of this hotel. The Hotel also has FREE WIFI .

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Friendly Staff, Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: scene13
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little gem of a hotel within easy walking distance of St. Mark's and the Rialto Bridge, but far enough away that you can find reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was beautifully appointed, warm and inviting -- a lovely place to return to after walking excursions. Breakfast was very special... not only the availability of items on the buffet, but the courteous staff, including a cheery sort of Breakfast Czar who happily answered on-the-spot requests for scrambled eggs, crepes, and flambeed bananas. The place is just great, and we would return there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of class”
Reviews.Author: SL51
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel within easy walking distance of St. Marks and Rialto. The rooms are not that big but have a luxury feel. The best of this hotel is the breakfast (Flambe Banana) in a superb dining room. The staff are excellent and obviously take pleasure in satisfying your needs. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Truly like a palace”
Reviews.Author: Lov_2_travel_10
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Palazzo Paruta. I can't say enough good things about this hotel; the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was spectacular (very classy decor, spacious, really nice bathroom, quiet, comfortable bed), the location was pretty central, and the breakfast was absolutely amazing. It was definitely the best breakfast I've ever had at a hotel and was one of the high points of my day, with everything from chocolate croissants to crepes, fresh fruit, caprese salad, meats, cheeses, and great hot chocolate. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: comfytraveller12
Reviews.Content: Make sure you Google map the location before you get there...it is not easy to find! The hotel is poorly sign posted on the exterior of the building and is not near the San Marco taxi station, closer to the San Angelo stop. Hotel was comfortable enough though the rooms were a little small. No wifi is available in the bedrooms, only at the reception which is a little silly. Breakfast is great though - espresso coffee on hand, good selection of fruits, yoghurts, pastries, meats and cheeses. Location is fine but good luck finding some decent food in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mcs6980
Reviews.Content: Was lead to believe after taking water taxi to Sant Angelo stop it is a two minute walk to hotel. Took at least 30 minutes. Not very pleasant with luggage in hand. No one willing to give you directions.Arrived at hotel exhausted from traveling. Not greeted warmly. Was given a room on the main floor with a terrible musty odor. The medicine cabinet opened up overlooking the courtyard. Not safe at all. Requested directions to restaurants. Was given out of way directions, got lost in Venice in the rain. Next morning ventured out to find just around the corner was a lovely area with restaurants. I would not recommend this hotel. Sorry to write this review, this was suppose to be the highlight of our trip and we were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Juros
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel, the staff we helpful and friendly, our room was so beautiful. Bed was very comfortable. From airport, catch orange line on the vaporetto and exit at St Angelo.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay and enjoy Venice”
Reviews.Author: bbbaltimore
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel in a central location to everything one would want to see or do in Venice. The hotel is clean, beautifully decorated and charming. The staff was pleasant and professional. The breakfast that was included was exceptional. Overall, it was a perfectly delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hideway but handy for everything”
Reviews.Author: Cruisers30
Reviews.Content: A beautiful well presented hotel, Hosted by all staff who were so friendly and willing to help. A beautiful room awaited us with a complementary glass of prosecco. Also complimentary on both birthdays that we celebrated whilst there. Hidden away from the hustle and bustle, but on the doorstep for noth St. Marks and Rialto bridge. Beautiful breakfast room, although you will have to ask for coffee, not very forthcoming. Breakfast is different, there is something for most tasted, providing you get there early as it does not seem to be replenished. Will recommend this hotel to our friends and family and are already planning our return in August next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel and Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Terri91256
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and this hotel in Venice was perfect! The room was spectacular and very large with 20 foot ceilings, antique furnishings, decorative moldings, Murano chandelier, view of the canal and more. The hotel had a lovely breakfast room with delicious food and the customer service was excellent. Nicole was the best! After a long train ride she offered us refreshment on the inside patio with Italian cookies. She had a bottle of Champagne waiting in our room with more cookies and she helped us not only print our boarding pass, find a great place for dining, but also arranged for us to travel to the Murano Glass Factory and more...she was wonderful! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. It is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Everton1974
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon trip around Italy and stayed at the Palazzo Paruta hotel in Venice. We arrived at 3pm and was a little a bit annoyed to find our room wasn't ready and that we would have to wait for 30 minutes. We did however enjoy a nice glass of Prosecco so that helped! The room was very small but clean and ok, It's not like you spend a lot of time in your room whilst in Venice! Breakfast in the morning was good as long as you arrived when it opened, once the food is gone its gone! We also find it very strange that the hotel had no bar for a drink. All in all, the service we received was excellent and the hotel is in a good location. This is however not a 4 star hotel and the website does a very good job of marketing this hotel! To sum up. Clean but small room, good location, good service, poor breakfast, no bar and not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A very quiet, friendly place, and a good place to work and rest”
Reviews.Author: bernhard_schulz
Reviews.Content: We found a very friendly, service-oriented place, excellent breakfast to take us through our busy days, very well located (although the steps in front of the door were sometimes hard to pass) in each direction we had to take. And the summer heat, well, that's something not even the best hotel can get you rid off!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional All Around”
Reviews.Author: S-Dubb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for only one night on our trip around the world. We travelled from Florence to Venice where we were catching a cruise. This hotel was exceptional - it was clearly marked and easy to find and even had a place where a water taxi could pull up. The receptionist who greeted us spoke perfect English, and was so welcoming and polite. When I asked her about internet access, she instantly printed me a code that we would use to login from our laptop. It worked seamlessly. Our room was clearly recently rennovated - wow! It had beautiful wood floors and these purple and silver wall coverings. It felt very posh and modern. The bathroom was a great size with a bidet, toilet, and shower. Given a bad experience at a hotel in Florence, we were thrilled to see that the shower actually had a door! Breakfast the next morning (complimentary) was amazing. They had everything - espresso, croissants, fruit, cereal - really, there was something for everyone. The location was also great - there were lots of places that we could walk to including St. Marks Square. We also found plenty of great restaurants nearby. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: lizziegirl255100
Reviews.Content: I loved it here! The hotel staff welcomed us with a wonderful glass of Prosecco and Venetian biscuits in their terraced garden, then personally showed us up to the room. It was beautiful and for a 700 year old building the plumbing, air con etc were fantastic! Romantic, clean and full of Venetian charm - stay here! Its close to all the tourist attractions but is quietly tucked away in the maze that is Venice. A short walk from the water taxi terminal and close also to the Grand Canal, Rialto Bridge and St.Marks square. Breakfast was fantastic and set in an elegant, ball room like, sun filled area with a good selection of fresh fruit and great coffee! The staff made this place. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: heathergill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real dream! The location is brilliant - in one of the nicest areas of the city- it even has its own bridge and gondola landing stage. Newly opened in a restored palazzo no expense has been spared on the lavish traditional Venetian fabrics and furnishings. We arrived late and had a magical experience walking the short distance to the hotel from the vaporetta stop in this lovely corner of Venice. Our room was beautiful and we were provided with a bottle of Prosecco and biscuits as I had taken a tip from a previous review and mentioned that it was our 10th wedding anniversary. The next day we were upgraded to an even more sumptious room which was larger with a much appreciated bath in a splendid marble lined bathroom.Breakfast was excellent in an elegant chandelliered room. Most appealing though was the entrance hall and the little outdoor courtyard, staircase and terrace prettily decorated with flowers. The staff are very courteous and friendly - not the case everywhere in Venice! A real find!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandAForever
Reviews.Content: This was a solid hotel. Things we liked: The hotel common areas and rooms were very clean. This was a good 4 star hotel. The staff was extremely accommodating, friendly and kind. The staff was very knowledge and helpful when making recommendations on directions, sights to see, restaurants and other small facts about the city. The room was a good size. We stayed in a standard room and a junior suite and both had plenty of room. The breakfast was a gourmet breakfast. The location of the hotel was great for sightseeing. If you stay at this hotel you have to eat at a restaurant that is very close to the hotel the food is amazing. Rosa Rossa has truly wonderful food and great service! The hotels staff can tell you were the restaurant is since it is so close to the hotel! Things that are not ideal: Although it is a very nice hotel, there are very few employees. All the employees work very hard but with only a few employees it can be challenging to provide the service that a hotel with many employees can provide. Also, the location can be challenging when arriving to and departing from the hotel. It is not on the Grand Cannel, so depending on the water level they have to drop you at a water taxi station about 3 min from the hotel and you then have to pull your luggage to or from the hotel. If the water level is low though a personal water taxi can drop you or pick you up right at the hotel dock. Also, the hotel has no restuarant or room service.

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo Paruta
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 3824 | (Campo Sant'Angelo), 30124 Venice, Italy
